title: mindseed - turn your expertise into impact
content:
This is the Privacy Policy for the learning and mindfulness platform mindseed that enables our customers (“Customers”) to create, share and provide mindfulness-based learning experiences to their end users (“End Users”). mindseed is a service of Kudima GmbH, c/o Startplatz Köln GmbH, Im Mediapark 5, D-50670 Köln Germany  (“Kudima”, "we", "us").

We take the protection of your personal data very seriously. This privacy policy informs you about the processing of personal data. The privacy policy applies to our platform and the services mentioned hereunder. Specific or supplementary privacy policies may apply to certain services.

We reserve the right to change this Privacy Policy in accordance with the applicable laws. We will give you notice of such changes by posting the revised Privacy Policy on this website or by other means.

1. Introduction & general information

The controller for the processing of personal data in connection with the offering of the platform services is Kudima. However, where a Customer uses our platform to provide its services to its End Users, such Customer is the controller for the processing of personal data of its End Users in connection with the Customer’s offers and Kudima will be only the data processor for the Customer.

You can find more information and contact details of Kudima in our legal notice https://mindseed.online/en/legal-notice

We process personal data on the basis of your consent, for the conclusion or performance of a contract or to the extent necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by us or by a third party (Art. 6 (1) (a), (b) and (f) DSGVO). In particular, we process personal data in order to provide our services to you, to offer your assistance in using our services, to answer your enquiries, to adjust and improve our products and services and to support our marketing. For further details please see the following.

As a Customer or End User you may access general information provided on our platform without identifying yourself or registering. However, when using our platform, you transmit data to us via your browser that is technically necessary to establish the connection and use our website. This includes, in particular, the date and time of the connection, your IP address, requested web pages and downloaded files, data on the transmission and use of the website, information on the browser and browser settings, operating system and device and the internet address from which you accessed our site. The data is stored and processed for technical reasons. We use this information to ensure the security of our web pages, to measure the effectiveness of internet advertising, to compile statistics and to measure the activities on the website with the aim of improving our offer.

If you would like to use our platform and services as a Customer or End User you will need to register. In such case we will collect certain information, including personal data, as further set out below.

When we ask you to provide us with certain personal data, we indicate whether the information is necessary to provide you with the relevant service. Required information is marked with an asterisk (*) or otherwise. All other information you provide to us is voluntary.

If you choose not to provide us with personal data when using services on our website, your decision will not have any material adverse consequences for you. However, you may then not be able to receive certain information via the website, you may not be able to use personalised services or register, or we may not be able to respond to enquiries fully or at all.

To the extent the processing of your personal data is based on your consent, you can withdraw your consent for the future at any time. You can use the contact details below for this purpose. We will promptly process any withdrawal notice.

2. Information for Customers

Customer’s responsibilities

If you are a Customer, your End Users needs to understand how you collect and process their personal data as the controller using our platform. If you use our services to provide mindfulness trainings and other services to your End Users, you agree to post an up-to-date privacy policy that complies with the laws applicable to your offering. You agree to obtain consent from your End Users for the processing of their personal data by Kudima and other parties on your behalf. If you process any special categories of personal data from your End Users such as data concerning health or other special categories of data, you will obtain explicit consent from your End Users for such processing.

Use of personal data

We collect your name and/or company name, address, e-mail address, phone number(s) and further information that might be required for registration and subscription to our services. In connection with the subscription to our services, we will store payment and invoice information. If you pay by card or other payment services providers, your payment details will be stored and processed only by the relevant payment service provider. We never store your card information in our systems and only use payment providers that are validated as payment provider. We use the personal data to provide you with our services, to confirm your or company’s identity, contact you, provide you with information regarding our services, manage our contract with you and invoice you.

We collect data about your use of our platform, including the use by your authorised users and administrators. We also collect data about how and when you access your account and our platform, including information about the device and browser you use, your network connection, your IP address and how you browse through our platform and the settings you might choose. We use this information to allow your usage of the platform, to administer the platform, to personalize services as applicable, to maintain and improve the platform and to provide support to you and End Users as applicable.

We may also process your personal data for the following purposes in accordance with the applicable data protection laws: (i) to prevent, investigate, or take action regarding illegal activities, suspected fraud, situations involving potential threats to the physical safety of any person, violations of our Terms of Service or any other agreement related to the services we provide, or as otherwise required by law; (ii) to help us conduct marketing and/or advertising campaigns; (iii) to conform to legal requirements.

Newsletter registration

We might offer newsletters in general or on specific topics, to which you might subscribe. If you would like to subscribe to a newsletter, we need your email address or other contact information as applicable. After registering for a newsletter, you will receive an email so that you can confirm your registration. By confirming, you allow us to send you regular information about our products and services in the form of a newsletter.

When we send a newsletter, we collect data about the sending and use of the newsletter. For this purpose, newsletters contain links to image files stored on our web servers. When you open a newsletter, your email program uploads these image files from our web server. This allows us to track whether and when our newsletters were opened and what content was read. We use the information collected in this way to make your use of the newsletters more attractive, to control the sending of newsletters and for statistical purposes. You can unsubscribe from a newsletter at any time by sending a message to us or via an unsubscribe link provided for this purpose in the newsletter, without incurring any costs other than the transmission costs according to the basic rates.

Registration for events

We offer from time to time that you can register for events (e.g. information events, guided tours, trade fairs). To do this, we need your name and email address and possibly other information that is required for the planning and implementation of the respective event.

Consent to advertising and customer satisfaction surveys

Provided you have given your consent, we will contact you by email or ask you to participate in online customer satisfaction surveys. Depending on the circumstances, we process information about your consent (date and time), about the services you use, the sending of the advertising or the customer satisfaction survey (in particular the content of our messages, date and time), information about the delivery and opening of the email, the data for establishing the connection between the website and your browser and device, and the information you provide in connection with the customer satisfaction survey. We associate this information with your existing Customer data so that we can better understand your interests and send you relevant information and offers. We might also use the data for statistical purposes. You can withdraw your consent to advertising and customer satisfaction surveys at any time with effect for the future by sending a message to us or via an unsubscribe link provided for this purpose in the respective email. This will not incur any costs other than the transmission costs according to the basic rates.

3. Information for End Users

If you are an End User that is using our Customer’s services provided through our platform, we will process the data required by our Customer to provide its services to you. The Controller in relation to your personal data will be our Customer. We will act as our Customer’s service provider and data processor. For our Customer’s use of your personal data please see the privacy policy of our Customer.

Generally, we will process your name and/or company name, address, e-mail address, phone number(s) and further information that might be required to administer your use of the Customer’s services. Furthermore, we will process information regarding your use of the Customer’s services, including your device, your browser, your IP address, settings, preferences and the use and status of your trainings, any billing information (as applicable) and further information as necessary for our Customer to provide its services to you. We use this information on behalf of our relevant Customer to administer your End User account and to provide personalized services on behalf of our Customer as applicable.

We may also process your personal data on behalf of our Customer for the following purposes in accordance with the applicable data protection laws: (i) to prevent, investigate, or take action regarding illegal activities, suspected fraud, situations involving potential threats to the physical safety of any person, violations of our Terms of Service or any other agreement related to the services we provide, or as otherwise required by law; (ii) to help us conduct marketing and/or advertising campaigns; (iii) to conform to legal requirements.

4. Cookies, analysis tools, tracking and targeting, social media

General Information

We use cookies on our website. Cookies are small files that are temporarily stored on your device. We use cookies for various purposes, which are described below.

We use our own cookies, in particular functional cookies, to make our website more user-friendly, to simplify registration and logging into the platform, to provide certain functions, to store the consent to or rejection of cookies and to ensure the security of our website and our systems. The corresponding cookies are necessary in order to be able to use our website functionally. Consent is not required for such necessary cookies.

We might also use third-party cookies, particularly in connection with the use of analytics tools, tracking and targeting technologies.

Measurement and analysis tools are used to better understand the use of our website and to optimise it accordingly. With the corresponding cookies, we might collect information about how you interact with our platform, and which pages you have visited. The information we collect or store with these cookies is aggregated and not linked to you as an individual. Such cookies are activated with your consent, and you can withdraw your consent at any time.

Tracking and targeting technologies might be used in order to optimise the delivery of advertising and other marketing on the internet. These cookies track and collect information about your online activities to help advertisers deliver more relevant advertising to you according to your interests. These cookies may share this information with other organisations or advertisers. Such cookies are activated with your consent, and you can withdraw your consent at any time.

We also might integrate certain so-called social media offers or external content on our websites. When using social media, you also use the respective offers of the social media providers, which also use cookies. Such cookies are activated with your consent, and you can withdraw your consent at any time.

In principle, you can also view our website without cookies. However, most browsers automatically accept cookies as the default setting. But you can prevent or restrict the storage of cookies on your end device. Please refer to the instructions of your browser manufacturer for details of how this works. You can delete cookies that have already been set at any time via your browser. You can use the "Do Not Track" settings of your browser to manage cookies. You can also deactivate cookies from certain third-party providers on the page of the "Digital Advertising Alliance" at http://www.aboutads.info/choices/ or on the page "Your Online Choices" at https://www.youronlinechoices.com. If you do not accept necessary cookies, this may lead to functional restrictions of our offers.

When using cookies from other providers ("third party cookies"), it is possible that the collected data may be transferred by the respective provider to a country outside the EU or the EEA that does not offer an adequate level of data protection. In particular, the US currently does not offer adequate protection under the GDPR because government authorities in the US have the right to access personal data held by companies under certain circumstances without adequate remedies being available to data subjects.

You can also use the Cookie Consent Management Tool integrated into our platform to manage your individual settings for the use of cookies. There you will also find detailed information on the individual cookies.

The tool enables you to give consent to data processing via the website, in particular the setting of cookies, as well as to make use of your right to withdraw consent already given.      The processing of data and the use of cookies is necessary for the documentation and administration of your settings.

5. Transfer of personal data to third parties

Personal data is processed by us as the controller and, for the purpose of providing services, is passed on to external processors that process the data exclusively on our behalf and in accordance with our instructions. If we use third-party providers that also might use certain data for their own purposes, we have described this in particular in connection with the information on cookies.

The transfer of personal data to domestic and foreign courts, authorities or other governmental institutions shall take place exclusively within the framework of the applicable laws.

6. Data processing by third parties and processing outside the EU or EEA

We process your personal data ourselves or may have processed data by external data processors that process the data exclusively on our behalf and in accordance with our instructions.

In some circumstances, data processing might be carried out on our behalf by a processor outside the EU or EEA. In such a case, unless there is an adequacy decision by the Commission in relation to the recipient country, we will agree with an appropriate service provider on adequate safeguards for the protection of personal data, in particular by agreeing the applicable EU standard contractual clauses.

In connection with the use of analysis tools, tracking and targeting technologies from third-party providers or the integration of social media offers, it is possible that the third-party providers also process data outside the EU or the EEA. Third-party providers might process personal data in the USA. The US currently does not provide adequate protection under the GDPR in particular because government authorities in the US have the right to access personal data held by companies in certain circumstances without adequate remedies available to data subjects.

7. Data security

We apply technical and organisational security measures to protect the personal data against destruction, loss, alteration or unauthorised disclosure of, or access to, such personal data. All personal data provided by you when using our services will be transmitted to us in encrypted form. We use a state-of-the-art encryption process for this purpose. Your data is password protected in the systems in which it is stored. The persons who have access to it are prohibited by strict security regulations from disclosing your data to third parties. Our IT security measures are continuously improved.

8. Your rights

You have the right to request access to and rectification or erasure of personal data concerning you or restriction of processing, or to object to processing as well as the right to data portability, in each case in accordance with the statutory provisions.

Where the processing of personal data is based on your consent, you have the right to withdraw your consent at any time, without affecting the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal.

You can also contact our data protection officer to assert your above rights.

You have the right to lodge a complaint with the competent supervisory authority in accordance with the statutory provisions if you are of the opinion that the processing of personal data concerning you infringes the statutory provisions. For this purpose, you may in particular contact the supervisory authority in the EU / EEA Member State of your habitual residence or of the place of the alleged infringement.

9. Contact details

If you have any questions or suggestions on the subject of data protection, please feel free to send them by email or letter to our data protection team, who can be reached at the following contact details:

By email: dataprotection@kudima.com

By post:

Kudima GmbH

Attn: Data Protection Team

c/o Startplatz Köln GmbH   

Im Mediapark 5

50670 Köln, Germany

Status: Sep. 2024
